DataElement.preferredName: Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate Result Requirement Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether the required results of an eGFR lab test were met.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate Result Requirement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A laboratory test that estimates kidney function (eGFR).  It is calculated using an individual's serum creatinine measurement, age, gender, and race.  Actual results are reported when the estimated glomerular filtration rate is less than 60 ml/min._The result of an action._Requirement; something that is necessary.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A laboratory test that estimates kidney function.  It is calculated using an individual's serum creatinine measurement, age, gender, and race.  Actual results are reported when the estimated glomerular filtration rate is less than 60 ml/min.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory test that estimates kidney function. It is calculated using an individual's serum creatinine measurement, age, gender, and race. Actual results are reported when the estimated glomerular filtration rate is less than 60 ml/min.

Property.preferredDefinition: The result of an action.:Requirement; something that is necessary.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/7/14 released DEC. tt 9/6/13 curated to support imaging trials. tt

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is pre-study eGFR greater tha
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study eGFR greater than or equal to 60 ml/min/1.73 m^2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study Glomerular filtration rate greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73 m2 according to the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) abbreviated formula, within 7 days prior to starting treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study Glomerular filtration rate greater than or equal to 30 mL/min according to the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) abbreviated formula, within 7 days prior to starting treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 51 mL/min, based on a 24-hour urine test for creatinine clearance or estimated using the Cockcroft-Gault equation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 unless data exists supporting safe use at lower kidney function values, no lower than 30 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 30 mL/min according to the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) abbreviated formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than 40 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 51 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than 30 mL/min/1.73m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 using the Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration (CKD-EPI) equation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73 m2 by the Cockcroft-Gault formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min using Cockcroft-Gault method?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 using the CKD-EPI formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is adult, is glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 39 mL/min/1.73m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN OR is glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 (based on the calculated CKD-EPI glomerular filtration rate estimation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min (via the CKD-EPI glomerular filtration rate estimation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2 unless data exists supporting safe use at lower kidney function values, no lower than 30 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is GFR  greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 (via the CKD-EPI glomerular filtration rate estimation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 40 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73m2?
